title: Array Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test index access, range reasoning, and array tradeoffs.

questions.question: Which array operation is typically O(1)?
questions.explanation: Direct index access computes the location without scanning.

questions.question: Why is middle insertion usually O(n) in arrays?
options: Existing elements may need to shift positions
questions.explanation: Elements after the insertion point are shifted to keep contiguity.

questions.question: Prefix sums are most useful for:
options: Repeated range-sum queries on mostly immutable data
questions.explanation: After one precompute pass, each range sum is answered in O(1).

questions.question: For inclusive indices [l, r], range sum from prefix array is:
questions.explanation: Prefix usually stores sum up to but excluding index i.

questions.question: Which is the best first structure for heavy random index reads?
questions.explanation: Arrays provide direct O(1) index access.

questions.question: A common array bug source is:
questions.explanation: Index bounds and inclusive/exclusive confusion often break correctness.
